meanings.definition: To turn over quickly or lightly
meanings.sent1: She flippest the pancake in the air.
meanings.sent2: He flippest the page of his book.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to flippest the toy mouse but missed.
meanings.sent4: The wind can flippest the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast can flippest in the air with grace.

meanings.definition: To move or toss with a quick motion
meanings.sent1: He flippest the coin into the air.
meanings.sent2: She flippest the ball to her friend.
meanings.sent3: The chef can flippest the vegetables in the pan skillfully.
meanings.sent4: The waves flippest the boat gently on the water.
meanings.sent5: The juggler can flippest the pins with ease.
